text: Hello, Is it possible to implement the login functionality in HubSpot? Like giving Login and sign up option to the user and then showing the data as per user? I am thinking about using hubdb table and then cross-checking user credential against it. But Please suggest am I thinking in the correct direction? Please respond if possible with example.
Enterprise has a user authentication feature. If not, I know <@U22PKFRU5> recently posted about one from inbound lands called booya. <https://w.inboundlabs.co/booya>

Hi Aj, I was going through <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cms-pages-editor/control-audience-access-to-pages?_ga=2.50586729.1945914156.1561795662-239009247.1549387897> provided by HubSpot. But I am not finding any Signup feature for the user. It is like providing a password to the user and then inform them though authenticate for a particular page with the login page. Please, can u help?
I want to implement login and signup functionality for the website. Please guide me for that.

Hello <@UJ2QKB849> :wave: We do have a simple user sign up / user access built into HubSpot - however - it is only available in the Enterprise level product. It is NOT available for CMS is they do not also have an Enterprise product also.

The Knowledge-base link you posted above is the best resource to get started.
We also have a slack channel dedicated to this feature -  check out  <#CD5RBLPBL|cms-membership> and post questions there.
If you  would like to test the functionality, you can always start an Enterprise product 14-day trial to test it out.

If you determine the built in HubSpot Membership functionality will not work for your project, you can look at 3rd party options. The link AJ posted above is the one I typically send to people to review.
